instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V, 1,4A charge but doesn't not start (<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 12" Macbook)
threads.message:
HI, I'm brand new here with repairing motherboards, and I got stuck while having 20V and 1.4A charging on the USB-C amp meter but no start. removing battery shows 20V, 0.5A which seems for me the MUX is working. No visual impacts on the motherboard, no liquid, no damage. any glue what are the first steps? 
thx in advance for your patience ;-)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V, 1,4A charge but doesn't not start (<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 12" Macbook)
threads.message: Dead CPU as always like every single 12?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V, 1,4A charge but doesn't not start (<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 12" Macbook)
threads.message:
Probably bad CPU.
Is better to refuse all these boards directly.
You can try to reflow entire board into IR oven, but no warranty at all.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V, 1,4A charge but doesn't not start (<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 12" Macbook)
threads.message: no good new but thx guys!
